name: BMW
desc: The luxury automotive division of The Daimler Group, Mercedes-Benz takes the second spot on our list of the most popular luxury car brands.

name: Audi
desc: As a manufacturer, Audi comes in at 34th/40 on the Reliability Index, indicating that it is Audi reliability is well below average.

name: Tesla
desc: Tesla's mission is to accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy through increasingly affordable electric vehicles.

name: Porsche
desc: The brand attributes much of this to its ever-growing model range, focusing especially heavily on the first fully electric Porsche.

name: Lexus
desc: Tech-laden” is the best way to sum up Lexus’ year in the automobile industry. While the brand hasn’t quite reached the top.

name: Volvo
desc: From the addition of five more of its models to the IIHS Top Safety Pick Plus list, to its increased paid parental leave.

name: Lamborghini
desc: Lamborghini boasted record profits in 2020, delivering 7,430 cars globally with profits of $1.9 billion.

name: Ferrari
desc: Ferrari Purosangue – the brand’s first-ever luxury SUV, in a move that came fairly unexpectedly.

name: Land Rover
desc: Land Rover is determined to stay one step ahead.The British car manufacturer remains one of the most popular luxury car.

name: Jaguar
desc: Contactless ‘predictive touch’ touchscreens, virus-fighting technology across the wider brand and the launch of the Jaguar.
